marketNews.title: BI Rate Cut by 25 bps to 4.75%, Outside Expectations
marketNews.content:
Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (17/9) cut the BI Rate by 25 bps to the level of 4.75%, outside of consensus expectations which projected no change. The lending facility was also cut by 25 bps to 5.5%, while the deposit facility was cut by 50 bps to 3.75%. With this decision, the BI Rate has fallen 125 bps since the beginning of 2025. 
Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, stated that this decision is an effort to encourage economic growth, while maintaining the stability of the Rupiah exchange rate and inflation in the range of 1.5-3.5% in 2025 and 2026. Perry added that this BI Rate cut also considers the high probability of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut at the meeting on Wednesday (17/9) local time, as well as the stable trend of the US Dollar Index (DXY) with a weakening tendency. Perry affirmed that his party welcomes the government's expansionary fiscal policy, including the placement of government cash reserves of 200 trillion rupiah in state-owned banks (Himbara), thus reflecting an all-out pro-growth stance from both state institutions.

marketNews.title: Discussion on Expanding Bank Indonesia's Mandate and DPR's Authority in Governor Dismissal related to the BI Rate Cut
marketNews.content: This BI Rate cut occurs amidst discussions in the DPR regarding adding Bank Indonesia's mandate and granting authority to the DPR to recommend the dismissal of the Bank Indonesia Governor, which is stipulated in the draft of the Bill on Financial Sector Development and Strengthening (P2SK) amendments. Kontan noted that the discussion on expanding the mandate includes "creating a conducive economic environment for real sector growth and job creation." Currently, BI's mandate is limited to stabilizing the Rupiah exchange rate, maintaining payment system stability, and supporting sustainable economic growth within the framework of maintaining financial system stability. The discussion on a new provision where the DPR has the authority to recommend the dismissal of Bank Indonesia's board of governors may increase concerns about Bank Indonesia's independence, according to a Bloomberg report. These concerns were highlighted again after Bank Indonesia and the government signed a new burden-sharing agreement.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway on BI Rate Decision
marketNews.content: We assess that Bank Indonesia's decision to cut interest rates again reinforces the signal that priority is given to economic growth recovery, following the announcement of the 3rd stimulus package for 2025 and the government's liquidity injection policy to Himbara. We also highlight that the cut in the deposit facility rate was larger than the BI Rate cut. The deposit facility rate itself is the overnight interest rate paid by Bank Indonesia on surplus funds placed by commercial banks, where this rate influences the overnight interbank loan rate. We assess that a larger cut in the deposit facility rate compared to the BI Rate is expected to increase the incentive for commercial banks to channel surplus funds as credit, rather than placing funds with other banks/Bank Indonesia. This initiative is taken considering the slow ongoing transmission of the BI Rate cut, where Bank Indonesia records that lending rates and 1-month deposit rates for banking have only decreased by -7 bps and -16 bps respectively from the beginning of the year up to August 2025.

marketNews.title: Other Macroeconomic Highlights
marketNews.content:
Bank Indonesia noted that banking credit growth reached +7.56% YoY as of 8M25 (vs 7M25: +7.03% YoY, 8M24: +11.4% YoY), lower than the 2025 target which has been downgraded by Bank Indonesia to the range of +8-11% YoY. Based on use, investment credit grew +13.86% YoY during 8M25 (vs 7M25: +12.42% YoY), while consumption credit was +7.89% YoY (vs 7M25: +8.11% YoY) and working capital was +3.53% YoY (vs 7M25: +3.08% YoY). On the funding side, Third Party Funds as of 8M25 grew +8.51% YoY (vs 7M25: +7% YoY), with a Loan-to-Deposit Ratio of 86.03 percent. 
President Prabowo Subianto conducted another reshuffle of the "Merah Putih" Cabinet on Wednesday (17/9), including shifting Erick Thohir's position from Minister of State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) to Minister of Youth and Sports and appointing Djamari Chaniago as Coordinating Minister for Political and Security Affairs. The State Secretary, Prasetyo Hadi, stated that the government has not yet appointed a definitive replacement for the new Minister of BUMN position. 
National Nutrition Agency stated on Tuesday (16/9) that the government plans to expand the Free Nutritious Food program to teachers and posyandu volunteers. Currently, the program only targets recipients who are children, pregnant women, and breastfeeding mothers. 
US Census Bureau noted that US retail sales in August grew +0.6% MoM (vs July: +0.6% MoM), exceeding consensus expectations which projected +0.2% MoM. Annually, US retail sales grew +5% YoY in August 2025 (vs July 2025: +4.1% YoY). Reuters reported that although US retail sales strengthened, economists still expect the Fed to cut interest rates at the meeting on Wednesday (17/9) local time due to the weakening US labor market. 
The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, told Reuters on Wednesday (17/9) that the free trade agreement with the European Union (IEU-CEPA) will be signed in Bali on September 23, 2025. Airlangga's statement came after the Financial Times reported on Tuesday (16/9) that European Union Trade Commissioner, Maros Sefcovic, would visit Indonesia to sign the agreement. Previously, Airlangga stated in June 2025 that the agreement would allow Indonesia to obtain zero tariffs for nearly 80% of its exported products to the European Union along with the removal of non-tariff barriers. The government also hopes that the European Union can accelerate the ratification process after the signing, so the agreement can take effect at the end of 2026 or 2027.

tickerNews.title: EMAS Sets IPO Price at Rp2,880/Share
tickerNews.content: EMAS: Merdeka Copper Gold's subsidiary, Merdeka Gold Resources, set its IPO offering price at 2,880 rupiah per share. In this IPO, EMAS will offer ~1.6 billion (10%) new shares, implying a target fund raising of ~4.66 trillion rupiah with a market capitalization of around ~46.6 trillion rupiah. The public offering schedule is September 17-19, 2025, and the listing schedule is September 23, 2025.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Announces Acquisition of Sakakemang and South Sakakemang PSC Stakes and Increased Stake in TGI
tickerNews.content: MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional announced it will acquire 45% of the participating interest along with operatorship in the Sakakemang PSC and 80% of the participating interest along with operatorship in South Sakakemang in South Sumatra, Indonesia. This transaction plan will be effective after obtaining approval from the government. The Sakakemang PSC has obtained approval for a plan of development from the Indonesian government and borders the Corridor PSC operated by MEDC. In a separate transaction, MEDC has also increased its stake in PT Transportasi Gas Indonesia (TGI) to 40%. TGI supplies natural gas from the Corridor PSC and other suppliers in the South Sumatra-Jambi region through pipeline networks to buyers in Riau, Batam, and Singapore. MEDC CEO, Roberto Lorato, stated that the total acquisition is valued at approximately 90 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: ADMR States Aluminum Smelter to Begin Gradual Operation in 4Q25
tickerNews.content: ADMR: Alamtri Minerals Indonesia stated that the aluminum smelter being built by the company through its subsidiary, PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry, will begin to operate gradually in 4Q25 with an initial capacity of 500,000 tons of aluminum ingot per year. The production capacity of this smelter will later be increased gradually to reach 1.5 million tons of aluminum ingot per year.

tickerNews.title: UBS Group AG Sold ~105 Million Shares of Bumi Resources, Reducing Stake to 6.99%
tickerNews.content: BUMI: UBS Group AG announced it had sold ~105 million shares of Bumi Resources on September 11, 2025, at a price of ~108 rupiah per share or totaling ~11 billion rupiah. After this transaction, UBS Group AG's ownership in BUMI decreased from 7.02% to 6.99%. UBS Group AG explained that this transaction was intended for client derivative hedging activities.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Shareholders Approve Changes to Board of Directors and Commissioners, Eliminating Deputy President Director Post and Introducing New Legal Director Post
tickerNews.content: TLKM: Telkom Indonesia shareholders on Tuesday (16/9) approved changes to the company's board of directors and commissioners. The position of Deputy President Director, previously held by Muhammad Awaluddin, was abolished. Meanwhile, a new position called Director of Legal and Compliance was introduced, which will be filled by Andy Kelana. TLKM also removed one Commissioner position held by Ismail and appointed Ira Noviarti as an independent commissioner, who previously served as President Director at Unilever Indonesia during the period 2020-2024.

tickerNews.title: OLIV Controller and Shareholders Sign Agreement to Divest 77.9% of Shares to Non-Affiliate Parties
tickerNews.content: OLIV: Oscar Mitra Sukses Sejahtera announced that the controller and shareholders of the company - Hendro Jap and Hioe Mie Tjen - have signed an agreement to divest 77.9% of OLIV shares to non-affiliated parties consisting of PT Olive Power Invest, PT Motif Investasi Indonesia, and PT Pacific Prima Permata. The transaction value has not been announced. This transaction plan will take place in 2 stages, with the first stage scheduled for September 18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: NINE Announces New Controller After Poh Holdings Pte. Ltd. Acquired ~35.85% Stake, Lowering Purchase Price for Part of the Acquisition Due to Debt Obligations
tickerNews.content: NINE: Techno9 Indonesia announced that Poh Holdings Pte. Ltd. has acquired ~773.4 million (35.85%) shares of NINE from the company's controller, Heddy Kandou. Of this amount, approximately ~413.3 million (19.16%) shares were purchased at a price of ~12.2 rupiah per share, lower than the initial sale and purchase agreement at the 19 rupiah per share level, due to certain debts and obligations borne by the company. After this transaction is completed, Poh Holdings Pte. Ltd will become the new controller of NINE and will conduct a mandatory tender offer.
